member.name: M:FsCheck.Arbitrary`1.Shrinker(`0)
member.summary: Returns a sequence of the immediate shrinks of the given value. The immediate shrinks should not include doubles or the given value itself. The default implementation returns the empty sequence (i.e. no shrinking).

member.summary: Like <*>, but puts f in a Gen first.

member.summary: Bind operator; runs the first generator, then feeds the result to the second generator function.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen`1.Map``2(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{`0,``1})
member.summary: map the given function to the value in the generator, yielding a new generator of the result type.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Gen`1
member.summary: Generator of a random value, based on a size parameter and a randomly generated int.

member.name: T:FsCheck.DontSize`1
member.summary: Whereas most types are restricted by a size that grows as the test gets further, by applying this type the underlying type will ignore this size and always generate from the full range. Note that this only makes a difference for types that have a range - currently Int16, Int32, Int64 have DontSize Arbitrary instances. This is typically (and at least currently) only applicable for value types that are comparable, hence the type constraints.

member.name: T:FsCheck.DoNotSize`1
member.summary: Whereas most types are restricted by a size that grows as the test gets further, by applying this type the underlying type will ignore this size and always generate from the full range. Note that this only makes a difference for types that have a range - currently Int16, Int32, Int64 have DoNotSize Arbitrary instances. This is typically (and at least currently) only applicable for value types that are comparable, hence the type constraints.

member.name: T:FsCheck.DoNotShrink`1
member.summary: Use the generator for 'a, but don't shrink.

member.name: T:FsCheck.DontShrink`1
member.summary: Use the generator for 'a, but don't shrink.

member.name: M:FsCheck.ArbitraryExtensions.MapFilter``1(FsCheck.Arbitrary{``0},System.Func{``0,``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Return an Arbitrary instance that is a mapped and filtered version of an existing arbitrary instance. The generator uses Gen.map with the given mapper and then Gen.suchThat with the given predicate, and the shrinks are filtered using Seq.filter with the given predicate. This is sometimes useful if using just a filter would reduce the chance of getting a good value from the generator - and you can map the value instead. E.g. PositiveInt.

member.name: M:FsCheck.ArbitraryExtensions.Filter``1(FsCheck.Arbitrary{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Return an Arbitrary instance that is a filtered version of an existing arbitrary instance. The generator uses Gen.suchThat, and the shrinks are filtered using Seq.filter with the given predicate.

member.summary: Construct an Arbitrary instance for a type that can be mapped to and from another type (e.g. a wrapper), based on a Arbitrary instance for the source type and two mapping functions.

member.summary: Turn a specification into a property.

member.name: P:FsCheck.ICommandGenerator`2.InitialModel
member.summary: Initial state of model object. Should correspond to initial state of actual object.

member.name: P:FsCheck.ICommandGenerator`2.InitialActual
member.summary: Initial state of actual object. Should correspond to initial state of model object.

member.name: M:FsCheck.ICommandGenerator`2.Next(`1)
member.summary: Generate a number of possible commands based on the current state of the model. Preconditions are still checked, so even if a Command is returned, it is not chosen if its precondition does not hold.

member.name: T:FsCheck.ICommandGenerator`2
member.summary: Defines the initial state for actual and model object, and allows to define the generator to use for the next state, based on the model.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command`2.RunModel(`1)
member.summary: Executes the command on the model of the object.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command`2.RunActual(`0)
member.summary: Excecutes the command on the actual object under test.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command`2.Pre(`1)
member.summary: The default precondition is true.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command`2.Pre(`1)
member.summary: Precondition for execution of the command. When this does not hold, the test continues but the command will not be executed.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command`2.Post(`0,`1)
member.summary: The default postcondition is true.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command`2.Post(`0,`1)
member.summary: Postcondition that must hold after execution of the command. Compares state of model and actual object and fails the property if they do not match.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Command`2
member.summary: A single command describes pre and post conditions and the model for a single method under test. The post-conditions are the invariants that will be checked; when these do not hold the test fails.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Runner
member.summary: A custom test runner, e.g. to integrate with a test framework like xUnit or NUnit.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Arbitrary
member.summary: The Arbitrary instances on this class will be merged in back to front order, i.e. instances for the same generated type at the front of the list will override those at the back. The instances on Arb.Default are always known, and are at the back (so they can always be overridden)

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.EveryShrink
member.summary: What to print every time a counter-example is succesfully shrunk

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Every
member.summary: What to print when new arguments args are generated in test n

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.QuietOnSuccess
member.summary: If set, suppresses the output from the test if the test is successful.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.EndSize
member.summary: The size to use for the last test, when all the tests are passing. The size increases linearly between Start- and EndSize.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.StartSize
member.summary: The size to use for the first test.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Name
member.summary: Name of the test.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Replay
member.summary: If set, the seed to use to start testing. Allows reproduction of previous runs.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.MaxFail
member.summary: The maximum number of tests where values are rejected, e.g. as the result of ==>

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.MaxTest
member.summary: The maximum number of tests that are run.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.VerboseThrowOnFailure
member.summary: Like the Verbose configuration, only throws an exception with the error message if the test fails or is exhausted. Useful for use within other unit testing frameworks that usually adopt this methodolgy to signal failure.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Verbose
member.summary: The verbose configuration prints each generated argument.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.QuickThrowOnFailure
member.summary: Like the Quick configuration, only throws an exception with the error message if the test fails or is exhausted. Useful for use within other unit testing frameworks that usually adopt this methodolgy to signal failure.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Quick
member.summary: The quick configuration only prints a summary result at the end of the test.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Config.Default
member.summary: The default configuration is the quick configuration.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Config
member.summary: For configuring a run.

member.summary: The size to use for the first test.

member.summary: A custom test runner, e.g. to integrate with a test framework like xUnit or NUnit.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.Replay
member.summary: If set, the seed to use to start testing. Allows reproduction of previous runs.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.QuietOnSuccess
member.summary: If set, suppresses the output from the test if the test is successful.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.QuickThrowOnFailure
member.summary: Like the Quick configuration, only throws an exception with the error message if the test fails or is exhausted. Useful for use within other unit testing frameworks that usually adopt this methodolgy to signal failure.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.Quick
member.summary: The quick configuration only prints a summary result at the end of the test.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.Name
member.summary: Name of the test.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.MaxNbOfTest
member.summary: The maximum number of tests that are run.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.MaxNbOfFailedTests
member.summary: The maximum number of tests where values are rejected

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.EveryShrink
member.summary: What to print every time a counter-example is succesfully shrunk

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.Every
member.summary: What to print when new arguments args are generated in test n

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.EndSize
member.summary: The size to use for the last test, when all the tests are passing. The size increases linearly between Start- and EndSize.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Configuration.Default
member.summary: The default configuration is the quick configuration.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Configuration
member.summary: Configure the test run with a quick configuration.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Common.takeWhilePlusLast``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns a sequence that, when iterated, yields elements of the underlying sequence while the given predicate returns true, and then returns the last element, but none further.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Common.memoize``2(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``1})
member.summary: Memoize the given function.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Common.memoizeWith``2(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{``0,``1},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``1},``0)
member.summary: Memoize the given function using the given dictionary

member.name: T:FsCheck.Random
member.summary: Generate random numbers based on splitting seeds. Based Hugs' Random implementation.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Reflect.getUnionTagReader(System.Type)
member.summary: Get reader for union case name (aka tag)

member.name: M:FsCheck.Reflect.getUnionCases(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the case name, type, and functions that will construct a constructor and a reader of a union type respectively

member.name: M:FsCheck.Reflect.getRecordReader(System.Type)
member.summary: Get reader for record type

member.name: M:FsCheck.Reflect.getRecordConstructor(System.Type)
member.summary: Get constructor for record type

member.name: M:FsCheck.Reflect.getRecordFieldTypes(System.Type)
member.summary: Get information on the fields of a record type

member.name: M:FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass`1.Merge(FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass{`0})
member.summary: Merge the instances defined by the given instances type with the ones already defined in this TypeClass. Instances defined in the given type override the instances in this TypeClass instance.

member.name: M:FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass`1.InstanceFor``2
member.summary: Get the instance registered on this TypeClass for the given type parameter 'T. The result will be cast to TypeClassT, which should be 'TypeClass<'T> but that's impossible to express in .NET's type system.

member.name: M:FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass`1.GetInstance(System.Type)
member.summary: Get the instance registered on this TypeClass for the given type and optionally the given arguments. The result is of type 'TypeClass<'T>, dynamically.

member.name: M:FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass`1.DiscoverAndMerge(System.Boolean,System.Type)
member.summary: Discover instances for this TypeClass on the given type. Merge the result with this TypeClass, with the newly discovered instances overriding the instances on this TypeClass.

member.name: M:FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass`1.Discover(System.Boolean,System.Type)
member.summary: Make a new TypeClass with only the instances registered on the given type. Note that the instances of this TypeClass will not be registered on the new TypeClass. Use Merge in addition to achieve that, or use DiscoverAndMerge to do both.

member.name: M:FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass`1.Compare(FsCheck.TypeClass.TypeClass{`0})
member.summary: Compares this TypeClass with the given TypeClass. Returns, respectively, the new instances, overridden instances, new array instances, overridden array instances, new catch all or overridden catchall introduced by the other TypeClass.

member.name: T:FsCheck.TypeClass
member.summary: Haskell typeclass concept simulation. For internal use.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.variant``2
member.summary: Basic co-arbitrary generator transformer, which is dependent on an int. Only used for generating arbitrary functions.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.promote``2(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,FsCheck.Gen{``1}})
member.summary: Promote the given function f to a function generator. Only used for generating arbitrary functions.

member.summary: Generates a 2D array. The square root of the size is the maximum number of rows and columns.

member.summary: Generates a 2D array of the given dimensions.

member.summary: Generates an array using the specified generator. The maximum length is the size+1.

member.summary: Generates sublists of the given arguments.

member.summary: Generates sublists of the given IEnumerable.

member.summary: Generates sublists of the given sequence.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.NonEmptyListOf``1(FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Generates a non-empty list of random length. The maximum length depends on the size parameter.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.ListOf``1(FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Generates a list of random length. The maximum length depends on the size parameter.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Piles(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a random array of length k where the sum of all elements equals the given sum.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.SuchThat``1
member.summary: Generates a value that satisfies a predicate. Contrary to suchThatOption, this function keeps re-trying by increasing the size of the original generator ad infinitum. Make sure there is a high probability that the predicate is satisfied.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Filter``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary:
Generates a value that satisfies a predicate. Contrary to tryFilter, this function keeps re-trying by increasing the size of the original generator ad infinitum. Make sure there is a high probability that the predicate is satisfied.
The `filter` function is an alias for the `where` function. These two functions are identical, but co-exist so that you can choose the word that makes your code most readable in your given context.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Where``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary:
Generates a value that satisfies a predicate. Contrary to tryWhere, this function keeps re-trying by increasing the size of the original generator ad infinitum. Make sure there is a high probability that the predicate is satisfied.
The `where` function is also aliased as `filter`. These two functions are identical, but co-exist so that you can choose the word that makes your code most readable in your given context.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.SuchThatOption``1
member.summary: Tries to generate a value that satisfies a predicate. This function 'gives up' by generating None if the given original generator did not generate any values that satisfied the predicate, after trying to get values by increasing its size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.TryFilter``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary:
Tries to generate a value that satisfies a predicate. This function 'gives up' by generating None if the given original generator did not generate any values that satisfied the predicate, after trying to get values by increasing its size.
The `tryFilter` function is an alias for the `tryWhere` function. These two functions are identical, but co-exist so that you can choose the word that makes your code most readable in your given context.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.TryWhere``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary:
Tries to generate a value that satisfies a predicate. This function 'gives up' by generating None if the given original generator did not generate any values that satisfied the predicate, after trying to get values by increasing its size.
The `tryWhere` function is also aliased as `tryFilter`. These two functions are identical, but co-exist so that you can choose the word that makes your code most readable in your given context.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Shuffle``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Generates a random permutation of the given sequence.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.ListOf``1(System.Int32,FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Generates a list of given length, containing values generated by the given generator.

member.summary: Traverse the given enumerable into a generator of a list using the specified binder function to create generators. [category: Create generators from generators]

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Frequency``1(System.Tuple{System.Int32,FsCheck.Gen{``0}}[])
member.summary: Build a generator that generates a value from one of the generators in the given non-empty seq, with given probabilities. The sum of the probabilities must be larger than zero.
member.param: Array of tuples where each tuple contains a weight and a generator.
member.exception: Thrown if the sum of the probabilities is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Frequency``1(FsCheck.WeightAndValue{FsCheck.Gen{``0}}[])
member.summary: Build a generator that generates a value from one of the generators in the given non-empty seq, with given probabilities. The sum of the probabilities must be larger than zero.
member.exception: Thrown if the sum of the probabilities is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Frequency``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{FsCheck.WeightAndValue{FsCheck.Gen{``0}}})
member.summary: Build a generator that generates a value from one of the generators in the given non-empty seq, with given probabilities. The sum of the probabilities must be larger than zero.
member.exception: Thrown if the sum of the probabilities is less than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Frequency``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Tuple{System.Int32,FsCheck.Gen{``0}}})
member.summary: Build a generator that generates a value from one of the generators in the given non-empty seq, with given probabilities. The sum of the probabilities must be larger than zero.
member.param: Sequence of tuples where each tuple contains a weight and a generator.
member.exception: Thrown if the sum of the probabilities is less than or equal to 0.

member.summary: Build a generator that generates a value from one of the given generators, with equal probability.

member.summary: Build a generator that generates a value from one of the generators in the given non-empty seq, with equal probability.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.GrowingElements``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Build a generator that takes a non-empty sequence and randomly generates one of the values among an initial segment of that sequence. The size of this initial segment increases with the size parameter. Essentially this generator is Gen.elements but taking also the runtime size into account.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Elements``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Build a generator that randomly generates one of the values in the given non-empty seq.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Elements``1(``0[])
member.summary: Build a generator that randomly generates one of the values in the given non-empty seq.

member.summary: Generates an integer between l and h, inclusive.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Sample``1(System.Int32,System.Int32,FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Generates n values of the given size.

member.summary: Generates a value of the give size with the given seed.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Resize``1(System.Int32,FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Override the current size of the test. resize n g invokes generator g with size parameter n.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Sized``1(System.Func{System.Int32,FsCheck.Gen{``0}})
member.summary: Obtain the current size. sized g calls g, passing it the current size as a parameter.

member.summary: Obtain the current size. sized g calls g, passing it the current size as a parameter.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Map``2(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``1},FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Apply the function f to the value in the generator, yielding a new generator.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Fresh``1(System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Generate a fresh instance every time the generatoris called. Useful for mutable objects. See also constant.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Fresh``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{Microsoft.FSharp.Core.Unit,``0})
member.summary: Generate a fresh instance every time the generator is called. Useful for mutable objects. See also constant.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Gen.Constant``1(``0)
member.summary: Always generate the same instance v. See also fresh.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Gen
member.summary: Combinators to build custom random generators for any type.

member.name: T:FsCheck.GenBuilder.GenBuilder
member.summary: The workflow type for generators.

member.name: P:FsCheck.GenBuilder.gen
member.summary: The workflow function for generators, e.g. gen { ... }

member.name: T:FsCheck.GenBuilder
member.summary: Computation expression builder for Gen.

member.name: M:FsCheck.ReflectArbitrary.reflectGenObj(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{System.Type,FsCheck.Gen{System.Object}})
member.summary: Build a reflection-based generator for the given Type. Since we memoize based on type, can't use a typed variant reflectGen<'a> much here, as we need to be able to partially apply on the getGenerator. See also Default.Derive.

member.name: M:FsCheck.ReflectArbitrary.enumOfType(System.Type)
member.summary: Generate a random enum of the type specified by the System.Type

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Unit
member.summary: Generates (), of the unit type.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.UInt64
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint64 that is between 0 and size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.UInt32
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint32 that is between 0 and size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.UInt16
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint16 that is between 0 and size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.TimeSpan
member.summary: Generates an arbitrary TimeSpan. A TimeSpan is shrunk by removing days, hours, minutes, second and milliseconds.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.ThrowingFSharpFun``2
member.summary: Generate an F# function value that generates an instance of the function result type about half the time. The other times it generates one of a list of common .NET exceptions, including Exception, ArgumentException, ArithmeticException, IOException, NotImplementedException, OUtOfMemoryException and others.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.ThrowingFSharpFun``2(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Exception})
member.summary: Generate am F# function value that generates an instance of the function result type about half the time. The other times it generates one of the given exceptions.

member.summary: Generates a Func'4.

member.summary: Generates a Func'3.

member.summary: Generates a Func'2.

member.summary: Generates a Func'1.

member.summary: Generates an Action'3

member.summary: Generates an Action'1

member.summary: Generates an Action'0

member.summary: Generates arbitrary strings, which are lists of chars generated by Char.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.SByte
member.summary: Generates an arbitrary signed byte.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Option``1
member.summary: Generate an option value that is 'None' 1/8 of the time.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Object
member.summary: Generate an object - a boxed char, string or boolean value.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Nullable``1
member.summary: Generate a nullable value that is null 1/8 of the time.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.NormalFloat
member.summary: Generates a "normal" 64 bit floats (without NaN, Infinity, Epsilon, MinValue, MaxValue)

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.NonNull``1
member.summary: Generate underlying values that are not null.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.List``1
member.summary: Generate a System.Collections.Generic.List of values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Interval
member.summary: Generates an interval between two non-negative integers.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Int64
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int64 that is between -size and size. Note that since the size is an int32, this does not actually cover the full range of int64. See DoNotSize<int64> instead.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Int32
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int32 that is between -size and size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Int16
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int16 that is between -size and size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.IList``1
member.summary: Generate a System.Collections.Generic.IList of values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.IDictionary``2
member.summary: Generate a System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary of values. Shrinks by reducing the number of elements

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.ICollection``1
member.summary: Generate a System.Collections.Generic.ICollection of values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Function``2
member.summary: Generate a Function value that can be printed and shrunk. Function values can be generated for types 'a->'b where 'b has an Arbitrary instance.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.FSharpFun``2
member.summary: Generate a F# function value. Function values can be generated for types 'a->'b where 'b has an Arbitrary instance. There is no shrinking for function values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.FsList``1
member.summary: Generate a list of values. The size of the list is between 0 and the test size + 1.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Float32
member.summary: Generates arbitrary 32 bit floats, NaN, NegativeInfinity, PositiveInfinity, Maxvalue, MinValue, Epsilon included fairly frequently.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Float
member.summary: Generates arbitrary 64 bit floats, NaN, NegativeInfinity, PositiveInfinity, Maxvalue, MinValue, Epsilon included fairly frequently.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.FixedLengthArray``1
member.summary: Arrays whose length does not change when shrinking.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontSizeUInt64
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint64 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontSizeUInt32
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint32 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontSizeUInt16
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint16 that is uniformly distributed in the whole range of uint16 values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontSizeInt64
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int64 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontSizeInt32
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int32 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontSizeInt16
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int16 that is uniformly distributed in the whole range of int16 values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DontShrink``1
member.summary: Overrides the shrinker of any type to be empty, i.e. not to shrink at all.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeUInt64
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint64 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeUInt32
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint32 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeUInt16
member.summary: Generate arbitrary uint16 that is uniformly distributed in the whole range of uint16 values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeInt64
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int64 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeInt32
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int32 that is unrestricted by size.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeInt16
member.summary: Generate arbitrary int16 that is uniformly distributed in the whole range of int16 values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotSizeDateTime
member.summary: Generate arbitrary DateTime that is unrestricted by size. A DateTime is shrunk by removing its Kind, millisecond, second, minute and hour components.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DoNotShrink``1
member.summary: Overrides the shrinker of any type to be empty, i.e. not to shrink at all.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Dictionary``2
member.summary: Generate a System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary of values. Shrinks by reducing the number of elements

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Derive``1
member.summary: Try to derive an arbitrary instance for the given type reflectively. Generates and shrinks values for record, union, tuple and enum types. Also generates (but doesn't shrink) values for basic classes (i.e. either classes having a single constructor with immutable values or DTO classes with a default constructor and public property setters).

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Decimal
member.summary: Generate arbitrary decimal.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DateTimeOffset
member.summary: Generates an arbitrary DateTimeOffset between 1900 and 2100. A DateTimeOffset is shrunk first by shrinking its offset, then by removing its second, minute and hour components.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.DateTime
member.summary: Generates an arbitrary DateTime between 1900 and 2100. A DateTime is shrunk by removing its Kind, millisecond, second, minute and hour components.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Char
member.summary: Generates arbitrary chars, between ASCII codes Char.MinValue and 127.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Byte
member.summary: Generates an arbitrary byte.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Bool
member.summary: Generates an arbitrary bool.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.BigInt
member.summary: Arbitray instance for BigInteger.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Arrow``2
member.summary: Generate a function value. Function values can be generated for types 'a->'b where 'b has an Arbitrary instance. There is no shrinking for function values.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Array2D``1
member.summary: Generate a rank 2, zero based array.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Default.Array``1
member.summary: Generate a rank 1 array.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.MapFilter``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``0},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},FsCheck.Arbitrary{``0})
member.summary: Return an Arbitrary instance that is a mapped and filtered version of an existing arbitrary instance. The generator uses Gen.map with the given mapper and then Gen.suchThat with the given predicate, and the shrinks are filtered using Seq.filter with the given predicate. This is sometimes useful if using just a filter would reduce the chance of getting a good value from the generator - and you can map the value instead. E.g. PositiveInt.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Filter``1(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,System.Boolean},FsCheck.Arbitrary{``0})
member.summary: Return an Arbitrary instance that is a filtered version of an existing arbitrary instance. The generator uses Gen.suchThat, and the shrinks are filtered using Seq.filter with the given predicate.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Convert``2(Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``1},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``1,``0},FsCheck.Arbitrary{``0})
member.summary: Construct an Arbitrary instance for a type that can be mapped to and from another type (e.g. a wrapper), based on a Arbitrary instance for the source type and two mapping functions.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.From``1(FsCheck.Gen{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0}})
member.summary: Construct an Arbitrary instance from a generator and shrinker.

member.summary: Construct an Arbitrary instance from a generator and shrinker.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.From``1(FsCheck.Gen{``0})
member.summary: Construct an Arbitrary instance from a generator. Shrink is not supported for this type.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.shrinkNumber``4(``0)
member.summary: A generic shrinker that should work for most number-like types.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Shrink``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns the immediate shrinks for the given value based on its type.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Generate``1
member.summary: Returns a Gen<'Value>

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.From``1
member.summary: Get the Arbitrary instance for the given type.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Register``1
member.summary: Register the generators that are static members of the type argument.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Arb.Register(System.Type)
member.summary: Register the generators that are static members of the given type.

member.name: M:FsCheck.PropOperators.op_DotBarDot``2(``0,``1)
member.summary: Construct a property that fails if both fail. (cfr 'or')

member.name: M:FsCheck.PropOperators.op_DotAmpDot``2(``0,``1)
member.summary: Construct a property that succeeds if both succeed. (cfr 'and')

member.name: M:FsCheck.PropOperators.op_PercentGreater``1
member.summary: Add the given label to the property. Property on the left hand side, label on the right.

member.name: M:FsCheck.PropOperators.op_AtBar``1
member.summary: Add the given label to the property. label on the left hand side, property on the right.

member.name: M:FsCheck.PropOperators.op_BarAt``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Add the given label to the property. Property on the left hand side, label on the right.

member.name: M:FsCheck.PropOperators.op_EqualsEqualsGreater``1(System.Boolean,``0)
member.summary: Conditional property combinator. Resulting property holds if the property after ==> holds whenever the condition does.

member.name: T:FsCheck.PropOperators
member.summary: Operators for Prop.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.OfTestable``1(``0)
member.summary: Turns a testable type into a property. Testables are unit, boolean, Lazy testables, Gen testables, functions from a type for which a generator is know to a testable, tuples up to 6 tuple containing testables, and lists containing testables.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Within``1(System.Int32,System.Lazy{``0})
member.summary: Fails the property if it does not complete within t milliseconds. Note that the called property gets a cancel signal, but whether it responds to that is up to the property; the execution may not actually stop.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Label``1(System.String)
member.summary: Add the given label to the property. The labels of a failing sub-property are displayed when it fails.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Collect``2(``0)
member.summary: Collect data values. The argument of collect is evaluated in each test case, and the distribution of values is reported, using sprintf "%A".

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Trivial``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Count trivial cases. Test cases for which the condition is True are classified as trivial.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Classify``1(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Classify test cases. Test cases satisfying the condition are assigned the classification given.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Throws``2(System.Lazy{``1})
member.summary: Expect exception 't when executing p. So, results in success if an exception of the given type is thrown, and a failure otherwise.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.Given``2(System.Boolean,``0,``1)
member.summary: Depending on the condition, return the first testable if true and the second if false.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Prop.ForAll``2(FsCheck.Arbitrary{``0},Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc{``0,``1})
member.summary: Quantified property combinator. Provide a custom test data generator to a property.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Prop
member.summary: Combinators to build properties, which define the property to be tested, with some convenience methods to investigate the generated arguments and any found counter-examples.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command.ToProperty``2(FsCheck.ICommandGenerator{``0,``1})
member.summary: Turn a specification into a property.
Turn a specification into a property, allowing you to specify generator and shrinker.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command.Shrink``2(FsCheck.ICommandGenerator{``0,``1})
member.summary: Create a shrinker to reduce a sequence of Command objects so that the reduced sequence satisfies the given specification.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command.GenerateCommands``2(FsCheck.ICommandGenerator{``0,``1})
member.summary: Create a generator that generates a sequence of Command objects that satisfies the given specification.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Command.Generate``2(FsCheck.ICommandGenerator{``0,``1})
member.summary: Create a generator that generates a sequence of Command objects that satisfies the given specification.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Machine`2.Next(`1)
member.summary: Generate a number of possible commands based on the current state of the model. Preconditions are still checked, so even if a Command is returned, it is not chosen if its precondition does not hold.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Experimental.Machine`2
member.summary: Defines the initial state for actual and model object, and allows to define the generator to use for the next state, based on the model.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Operation`2.Run(`1)
member.summary: Executes the command on the model of the object.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Operation`2.Pre(`1)
member.summary: The default precondition is true.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Operation`2.Pre(`1)
member.summary: Optional precondition for execution of the command. When this does not hold, the test continues but the command is not executed.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Operation`2.Check(`0,`1)
member.summary: Excecutes the command on the object under test, and returns a property that must hold. This property typically compares the state of the model with the state of the object after execution of the command.

member.name: T:FsCheck.Experimental.Operation`2
member.summary: An operation describes pre and post conditions and the model for a single operation under test. The post-conditions are the invariants that will be checked; when these do not hold the test fails.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Setup`2.Model
member.summary: Initial state of model object. Must correspond to initial state of actual object.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.Setup`2.Actual
member.summary: Randomly generate the initial state of the actual object. Should still correspond to the initial state of model object; so you should only randomly generate parameters to the instance that don't affect the model. Note:make sure that each value is truly a new instance if the commands change the state of the object. Gen.connstant in particular is a bad idea - use Gen.fresh instead.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.StateMachine.ToProperty``2(FsCheck.Experimental.Machine{``0,``1})
member.summary: Turn a machine specification into a property.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.StateMachine.ForAll``2(FsCheck.Arbitrary{FsCheck.Experimental.MachineRun{``0,``1}})
member.summary: Check all generated runs, i.e. create a property from an arbitrarily generated run.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Experimental.StateMachine.ForOne``2(FsCheck.Experimental.MachineRun{``0,``1})
member.summary: Check one run, i.e. create a property from a single run.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Runner.init
member.summary: Force this value to do the necessary initializations of typeclasses. Normally this initialization happens automatically. In any case, it can be forced any number of times without problem.

member.name: P:FsCheck.Runner.consoleRunner
member.summary: A runner that prints results to the standard output.

member.name: M:FsCheck.Runner.onFinishedToString(System.String,FsCheck.TestResult)
member.summary: A function that returns the default string that is printed as a result of the test.
